title.native: 『食戟のソーマ 餐ノ皿』 遠月列車篇
title.romaji: Shokugeki no Souma: San no Sara - Tootsuki Ressha-hen
title.english: Food Wars! The Third Plate: Totsuki Train Arc

description:
The second half of the third season of Shokugeki no Souma.

A dark age of cooking befalls Tootsuki Culinary Academy. With the Elite Ten's devastating coup d'état, Azami Nakiri is now the director of the prestigious school. Students must now conform to Azami's ideology of "true gourmet food" and are forbidden to express creativity, or else face expulsion.

However, Souma Yukihira and the members of the Polar Star Dormitory refuse to accept these changes. Aided by other rebellious first-years, including the tenth seat, Erina Nakiri, Souma and his allies band together to fight off supporters of Azami's regime. But corrupt instructors and the menacing Central organization stand in their way, and so they must work together, harder than ever before, to survive every underhanded plot designed to banish them from the school.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: 食戟之灵 餐之皿 远月列车篇
ยอดนักปรุงโซมะ ภาค 3 ครึ่งหลัง

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

node.description:
__Doujin Circle:__ Hikakuteki Simple na Panty (比較的シンプルなパンティ)

[Blog](http://tosh2367.blog108.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Syunsaeki) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/88701)

Was an assistant of [Tadahiro Miura](https://anilist.co/staff/111985).

[Twitter](https://x.com/yonetanikantoku)

Yoshitomo Yonetani was born  in Tokyo and graduated Tokyo Designer Gakuin. He is the leader of Studio 7 at Sunrise and was responsible for their super robot cult series Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar as well as Brigadoon and Betterman.

Yoshitomo was inspired working in the animation industry after having seen Mirai Shounen Conan.

He started as production assistent at Toei Douga, before moving to Shin-Ei Douga and finally Sunrise.

Other than anime director he is also a song writer for several anime series and sings anime themes under the name of ※-mai.

__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

Website | Twitter | Facebook | YouTube Introduction Luck Life is a band which began its activities formally in 2008. It was originally formed in 2005, as its members were classmates at Ibaraki East High School in Osaka Prefecture. Their major debut was with the Bungou Stray Dogs ending theme "Namae wo Yobu yo" in 2016. Members - [PON](https://anilist.co/staff/149059/Masumi-Ueno) (Masumi Ueno) - vocal, guitar - Ikoma (Takahide Ikoma) - guitar, chorus - Taku (Takuya Kubo) - bass - LOVE Ooishi (Yutaka Ooishi) - drums

[Website](http://xfoxtailsx.com) | [Artist Profile (Lantis)](http://www.lantis.jp/artist/foxtails/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/foxtails_kon)

**Introduction:**
Fo'xTails (フォックステイルズ) was a Japanese five-piece rock-band under record label Lantis (2015-2018).

**Final Members:**
- [Takao](https://anilist.co/staff/163423/Takao-Sakuma) (タカオ) - vocalist
- Narukaze (鳴風) - guitarist
- Sakamoto Takayuki (坂本尭之) - bassist
- [TERA](https://anilist.co/staff/153833/Kenji-Terazono) (テラ) - guitarist, programmer

**Former Members:**
- Takahiro (峻洋) - drummer

[Website](https://morisaki-yuki.amebaownd.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/morisakitchen/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/morisaki-yuki/)

A Japanese chef, culinary researcher and TV personality.
Also is a writer, producer and director for ADV Films and Robotboy Films.
Also is a writer, producer and director for ADV Films and Robotboy Films.
Producer and VP of business and legal affairs with formerly ADV and now Sentai Filmworks.

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.
